meanings.definition: A flattened stem that resembles and functions as a leaf.
meanings.sent1: The phylloclade of the cactus stores water and performs photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the phylloclade of the plant to understand its structure.
meanings.sent3: The phylloclade of the succulent decided to take a break from being a stem and pretended to be a leaf for a day.
meanings.sent4: The phylloclade of the plant waved in the wind, mimicking the dance of the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The green phylloclade stood out among the other stems, looking like a leaf in disguise.

meanings.definition: A modified stem that performs the function of a leaf.
meanings.sent1: The phylloclade of the desert plant helps it survive in harsh conditions.
meanings.sent2: Grafting a phylloclade onto another plant can enhance its ability to photosynthesize.
meanings.sent3: The phylloclade of the tree decided to show off its leaf-like skills at the stem talent show.
meanings.sent4: The phylloclade of the vine reached out like a leafy hand to catch the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The phylloclade of the succulent was a master at blending in with the leaves, fooling even the keenest observer.
